subtitle: New Thinking Allowed
Conversations on the leading edge of knowledge and discovery with parapsychologist
Jeffrey Mishlove
Hello and welcome. I’m Jeffrey Mishlove.
Today I’d like to talk to you about the
conflict that exists within some
parapsychological circles between
psychokinesis, or mind over matter,
versus precognition, or looking into the future. Along the way, we’ll also touch on other
related concepts, such as synchronicity,
really, a deeper concept I think that hasn’t really got much
leeway, much traction yet in the parapsychological
literature. I call it “manifesting.”
Incidentally, if you watch this video to the end, if you’re interested in obtaining one of these rainbow yin/yang
pins – these lapel pins that I wear – I’ll explain to you how you can get one.
When I first wrote my book some
21 years ago, The PK Man, based on research that I did between 1976 and
1987 with a man named Ted Owens, who demonstrated what he called enormous psychokinetic abilities.
A review of the book was published by my good friend Stephen Braude, the philosopher, an
analytical philosopher, a brilliant
parapsychologist, and he took issue with
something I wrote in the book. You see, Ted Owens, for those of you who may not know,
produced like 160 demonstrations. He’d send out letters saying, “I am going to cause…”
such and such an event:
“I’m going to end the drought... I’m going to cause a heat wave in the middle
of winter... A cold wave in the middle of summer... I’m going to make UFO appearances occur…
I’m going to stop a volcano…
I’m going to manifest earthquakes,
or power black outs…
I’m going to cause these things.” Very often, these unusual events did occur but in my book I said
I’m not sure whether he did these things by precognition –
that is, predicting that they would happen – or
whether he actually caused them, as he said he did. To makes matters even more complex, if you
tried to pin him down he’d say, “Well, I caused it, but how I caused it was I sent a telepathic message to space
intelligences,
other dimensional alien beings who existed in a giant invisible UFO over the surface of the earth.
They sat at a big council where they received the telepathic messages and then, they, through their
technology or whatever powers they had, they caused these events to occur.
So, it was all quite complex. But Stephen Braude, in reviewing my book, took real issue.
He said, “How can you make the claim that this might have been precognition. He obviously
felt like he was causing it.” And he did. He didn’t really claim to be
precognitive, in most instances. Although in one or two,
he actually did. He predicted, for example, that frogmen from Cuba were going to try and
attack, or swim onto shore, in Key Biscayne,
Florida where Richard Nixon had a property.
That turned out to be true. So, he had some precognitive abilities.
But Braude felt that we have to give psychokinesis more acknowledgement.
Now, on the other hand,
my good friend Ed May –
I’ve done multiple interviews with both Braude and Ed May on the New Thinking Allowed channel.
I encourage those of you who really want to be up on
parapsychology to check them all out
on our listings page. If you look in the
descriptions of every video, you’ll see a link to our listings page. [It] lists every single video.
Ed May tends to feel that we could boil all
psychic phenomena down to
precognition, seeing the future. One way that he is
able to justify that argument is pretty much by dismissing all
psychokinesis as not sufficiently proven.
Steve Braude would take great umbrage at that because, as he mentions
in one of our interviews, he personally witnessed a table levitation
when he was young. I think he even said, “We tried to pull it down,
we couldn’t. It stayed up out of its own accord.”
There are many examples in the literature of unusual
psychokinetic manifestations.
If you look in our future upcoming releases,
you’ll see a video with the journalist Leslie Kean – spelled K E A N – who
personally witnessed spirit
materialisation, full form
materialisation, going on in seances, as well as partial
materialisations. Stanley Krippner has witnessed apports.
We could go on and on about the medicine power of Native Americans,
shamans, for example. Many, many examples of ostensible
psychokinesis. Ed May would simply say, “None of that has been verified in the same kind of rigorous,
experimental set ups that have demonstrated precognition over and over and over again.”
I know that Ed May really tried to do it. He had good funding
at the time. He concluded that you just can’t design an experiment to test
psychokinesis that would rule out every possible artefact that might occur. So,
he sort of just dismisses
psychokinesis that way. From his point of view
everything in The PK Man can be explained as precognition and I can’t disagree with him on that –
even though Braude took umbrage at my pointing that out.
There are other ways to look at it. Ed May has done some rigorous
analysis of micro-PK in which we use quantum mechanical random event
generators and people try to influence them. At the Princeton Engineering
Anomalies Research Lab – the PEAR lab – P E A R – Princeton Engineering Anomalies Research -
you may recall we’ve interviewed
Brenda Dunne and Roger Nelson, who worked at that laboratory and
did extensive studies with quantum mechanical random event generators that they
interpreted as psychokinesis.
Ed May has gone back and analyzed that data and, based on his statistical analysis –
I don’t want to go into the details now – but he says, “No, the data really looks much more like precognition.”
That is, when people press the start button they press it at the moment in which they are able to
augment the data so that they get one or two extra hits and that’s a function
that he called the “data augmentation theory.” But, it’s an example of precognition
and we have many other experiments that prove
or demonstrate precognition under rigorous conditions,
so Ed has a point to make. But there are other ways of looking at it.
You could think of it in terms of synchronicity. Walter von Lucadou,
in Germany – in Friberg,
Germany – both a physicist and a psychologist who’s done some elegant theoretical work and
experimental work in which he believes that a synchronicity model provides a better explanation
for the random event generator data than either precognition or
psychokinesis. So there’s that. Now my own personal opinion is
that I think a better word to
express what’s going on is
“manifesting.” Each and everyone of us has a responsibility
to manifest our own lives. We manifest the people we are friends with. We
manifest the environment in which we live. We manifest the kind of people we are.
Are you the best version of yourself? That’s your
responsibility to manifest that. I think we manifest things in reality itself. Reality is quite malleable,
and so if I’m a strong believer in
precognition, I can manifest a lot of events that
confirm that belief. If I’m a strong believer in life after death,
I can manifest events that confirm that belief. If I’m a strong believer in the powers of
magic, I can manifest that. Is it psychokinesis? Well, I think what’s going on is
more complex than our puny minds and our puny brains are really able to grasp
because we’re dealing with the mysteries of time and space.
We’re dealing with the mysteries of personal identity.
The truth of the matter is we are mortal humans with
amazing abilities, but nonetheless
limited abilities, as amazing as they are. I think that as
parapsychology moves into the future we’re going to see new categories,
new ways of thinking about these things.
I’d also like to let you know, we’re going to have an online PK party on
the 16th of July with Sean McNamara. So,
for those of you who are interested bring your forks and spoons. We’ll see if you can actually
exhibit psychokinesis of that sort at that time.
Let me say a few things about metal bending.
I did sponsor Uri Geller's first major public appearance in the United States back in the early
1970s. We had thousands of people come to witness his performances at Zellerbach Auditorium at the University
of California, Berkeley campus. I had Uri on my radio program, on
KPFM, many times back in those days. One of the intriguing things that would happen is
that Uri would
bend spoons and forks using ostensible psychokinetic abilities, that was well known.
Controversial, you can bet. Even today,
fifty years later nearly, still very controversial.
But what began to happen at the time is that
dozens of people, even hundreds, would call into the radio station and say, “Oh my gosh. The clock that
hasn’t run for years has started running in my house. And the silverware is bending right in front of my eyes.”
This would happen all across the world when Uri made his public appearances. It suggests to me
that what we call psychokinetic abilities are latent in the population.
People just need a little bit of permission to express those abilities.
That’s why people began – Jack Houk is the man who started PK parties – and it became a fad
across the United States and elsewhere. That when people would come together
in an atmosphere of fun and carefree,
relaxed ability things happen, metal starts bending. What people experience is that the metal becomes soft,
so it requires no real muscular force. People find that they can take the tines of a fork and twist them and
curl them up and do things that would be impossible if it were rigid metal. It happens
widely. So, July 16th, check your listings when we do the live
PK Party. It’s going to be at 9am
Mountain Time, USA Mountain Time. I might also mention,
considering psychokinesis, on the 14th of July,
I’m going to release an interview with Caroline Cory because she’s produced a new documentary called
Superhuman: From the Invisible to the Visible. Caroline is a very gifted healer who also has psychokinetic
abilities. She demonstrates long distance psychokinesis,
rather rigorous scientific set up, on this documentary.
It’s going to be publicly released on July 14th which is the same day
I’m going to release the interview with Caroline and you’ll be able to see a
psychokinetic demonstration there. Sean McNamara
who will be with us live in a YouTube Live Stream on the 16th is part of that documentary.
So, really the psychokinesis is beginning to
come more to the fore. You know, when I first published The PK Man people
encouraged me to, you know, “Tell us how to do psychokinesis.” I wanted to discourage people. In fact, when
I went through the Ted Owens training on psychokinesis, and he said,
“How do you want to use this?” I realised I had no interest in making storms appear or
calling up UFOs. I said I want to manifest a life in
which I am able to communicate the realities of the esoteric and psychic world to the public at large.
And, I guess, my being here with you right now is an example of that manifestation.
But, wait, I did promise you that I would let you know how you can obtain a
lapel pin if you want one. We used to have them for sale on the New Thinking Allowed Foundation website,
that is newthinkingallowed.org. They’re only $12.99 plus shipping.
It wasn’t working for quite a while. I disabled the shopping cart. We couldn’t even figure out shipping costs. But, because of our
helpful volunteers we have it up and running now.
So, if you go to newthinkingallowed.org and click on the tab at the upper
end of the website, for donating –
I’d love to have you donate – but if you’d like to just purchase one of these from the Donate button
there, you can get into the shop. There you can find a few other items, including these pins.
They’ll be available for you. Now, let me leave you with this question: How are you manifesting in your
life? Are you experiencing precognitive abilities? Can you see into the future?
Do you think the future has already happened so you can see it? Or, perhaps you’re like my
friend Christian De Quincey who says, “You can’t predict the future because it hasn’t happened yet.”
How’s it working for you? Or, are you sort of synchronistically flowing through your life?
Think about these things. And,
thank you for being with me.
